item.title: 三星电子预计先进芯片封装业务的销售额将达到或超过 1 亿美元
item.description: 三星电子联席首席执行官 Kye-Hyun Kyung 周三表示，预计今年先进芯片封装业务的收入将达到或超过 1 亿美元。【原文：Samsung Electronics expects $100 million or more of revenue from its advanced chip packaging business this year, co-CEO Kye-Hyun Kyung said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 中国央行改组货币政策委员会
item.description: 中国央行表示，已对货币政策委员会进行改组，包括证券监管机构负责人吴庆、央行副行长宣昌能和两名新的学术委员。【原文：China's central bank said it has reshuffled its monetary policy committee to include securities regulator head Wu Qing, vice central bank chief Xuan Changneng and two new academic members.】

item.title: 美联储会议前亚洲股市震荡，日元创四个月新低
item.description: 周三，由于担心美联储可能发出今年放缓降息步伐的信号，亚洲股市犹豫不决，而日元则创下了四个月来的新低，因为市场预期日本的宽松政策还将持续一段时间。【原文：Asian shares were hesitant on Wednesday on concerns the Federal Reserve could signal a slower path of rate cuts this year, while the yen plumbed a fresh four-month low on expectations that policy in Japan will remain accommodative for a while longer.】

item.title: 特斯拉将从 4 月 1 日起上调中国生产的 Y 型车价格
item.description: 特斯拉周三向路透社证实，该公司将从 4 月 1 日起把在中国生产的 Model Y 汽车价格上调 5000 元（约合 694.55 美元）。【原文：Tesla will raise the price of China-produced Model Y vehicles by 5,000 yuan ($694.55) from April 1, the company confirmed to Reuters on Wednesday.】

item.title: 日元在四个月低点附近徘徊，美联储成为焦点
item.description: 周三，日元兑美元在四个月低点附近徘徊，兑欧元则跌至16年低点，此前一天，日本央行在广泛预期中决定结束负利率政策。【原文：The yen languished near a four-month low against the U.S. dollar and a 16-year trough against the euro on Wednesday, a day after the Bank of Japan's widely anticipated decision to end its negative interest rate policy.】

item.title: 中国一如预期维持基准贷款利率不变
item.description: 周三，中国在月度定盘会上维持基准贷款利率不变，符合市场预期，在此之前，中国央行上周在总体经济出现一些改善迹象的情况下保持了关键政策利率的稳定。【原文：China left benchmark lending rates unchanged at a monthly fixing on Wednesday, in line with market expectations, after the central bank kept a key policy rate steady last week amid some signs of improvement in the broad economy.】

item.title: 美元走强抑制需求，石油从数月高点回落
item.description: 油价在周三亚洲早盘交易中走低，原因是美元走强抑制了投资者的胃口，同时交易商在基准油价在过去两个交易日中均升至数月高点后从桌面上撤出了一些资金。【原文：Oil prices edged lower in early Asian trading on Wednesday, as a stronger dollar curbed investor appetite while traders took some money off the table after benchmarks rallied to multi-month highs in each of the past two sessions.】

item.title: 迪拜交易所将在二次发行中出售股票，纳斯达克股票下跌
item.description: 周二，纳斯达克宣布二次发行股票，迪拜证券交易所（Borse Dubai）将削减其在美国证券交易所的少数股权，纳斯达克股票在盘后交易中下跌超过 2%。【原文：Shares of Nasdaq fell more than 2% in extended trading on Tuesday following the announcement of a secondary share offering that will allow Borse Dubai to slash its minority stake in the U.S. stock exchange.】

item.title: 日本央行平稳退出负利率的计划是如何瓦解的？
item.description: 12 月的一个阴天，日本央行行长上田一夫和两位副行长聚集在该行东京总部，日本央行有序退出多年大规模刺激政策的战略随之瓦解。【原文：The Bank of Japan's strategy for an orderly exit from years of massive stimulus unraveled on an overcast day in December when Governor Kazuo Ueda and two deputies gathered at the bank's Tokyo headquarters.】

item.title: 美国联邦航空局（FAA）称，波音公司在提高 737 生产量之前必须提高质量
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局局长表示，波音公司必须改善安全文化并解决质量问题，该局才会允许这家飞机制造商提高 737 MAX 的产量。【原文：The head of the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration said Boeing must improve safety culture and address quality issues before the agency will allow the planemaker to boost 737 MAX production.】

item.title: Nvidia 年度开发者大会的主要收获
item.description: 英伟达（Nvidia）在本周举行的年度开发者大会上发布了下一款大型人工智能芯片，同时还推出了多项合作计划和软件工具，力图在人工智能热潮的竞争中保持领先地位。【原文：Nvidia unveiled its next big AI chip along with several partnerships and software tools at its annual developer conference this week, seeking to maintain its lead in the race to power the artificial intelligence boom.】

item.title: 制药商恩度破产重组获美国法院批准
item.description: 破产制药商恩度国际公司（Endo International）周二表示，美国破产法院已经批准了其重组计划和相关的阿片类药物和解方案，以摆脱2022年开始的破产程序。【原文：Bankrupt drugmaker Endo International said on Tuesday a U.S. Bankruptcy Court has approved its restructuring plan and related opioid settlements to emerge from bankruptcy, which began in 2022.】

item.title: 独家报道波音考虑在潜在的 Spirit Aero 交易中放弃空客的工作
item.description: 波音公司正在研究 Spirit AeroSystems 公司如何摆脱或大幅减少与空中客车公司的关系，因为这家供应链巨头为这家欧洲飞机制造商所做的工作给竞争对手波音公司试图收购其前子公司带来了麻烦。【原文：Boeing is looking at how Spirit AeroSystems could shed or sharply reduce its ties to Airbus , as the supply-chain giant's work for the European planemaker poses complications in rival Boeing's attempt to acquire its former subsidiary.】

item.title: 美国参议院小组加紧调查航空公司收费问题
item.description: 美国参议院一个小组周二表示，正在加紧调查航空公司每年数十亿美元的行李费、选座费、改签费和其他服务费，并要求航空公司在下个月之前做出答复。【原文：A U.S. Senate panel on Tuesday said it was stepping up its investigation into billions of dollars in annual airline fees for baggage, seat selection, ticket changes and other services, demanding airline responses by next month.】

item.title: Chipotle 董事会批准 50 对 1 的股票分割
item.description: 墨西哥卷饼连锁店 Chipotle Mexican Grill 周二表示，董事会已批准对其普通股进行 50 对 1 的拆分，这使得该公司股价在延时交易中上涨了约 7%。【原文：Chipotle Mexican Grill said on Tuesday its board had approved a 50-for-1 split of its common stock, sending the burrito chain's shares about 7% higher in extended trading.】

item.title: 俄勒冈州卫生局审查 UnitedHealth 对 Amedisys 的收购案
item.description: Amedisys 周二表示，俄勒冈州卫生局已开始对联合健康集团（UnitedHealth Group）斥资 33 亿美元收购这家家庭保健和临终关怀服务提供商的交易进行审查。【原文：Amedisys said on Tuesday Oregon's health authority has started a review of UnitedHealth Group's $3.3 billion acquisition of the home health and hospice caregiver.】

item.title: 诺德斯特龙百货公司和梅西百货公司的交易可能会使美国零售商重新流行私有化
item.description: 美国最大的上市连锁百货公司可能会被私人股本或对冲基金收购，从而极大地改变美国的零售业格局。【原文：America's biggest publicly traded department store chains could be set for private-equity or hedge-funds ownership, dramatically changing the retail landscape in the United States.】

item.title: 随着改革的推进，花旗集团已出售大部分非美国消费者业务
item.description: 花旗集团已出售了 14 个地区中 9 个地区的非美国消费者业务，并 "大幅削减 "了另外 3 个地区的业务。【原文：Citigroup has sold its non-U.S. consumer businesses in nine out of 14 regions and "substantially wound down" three more, as the lender undergoes its biggest overhaul in more than two decades to simplify its business and boost profitability.】

item.title: ESPN 与大学橄榄球季后赛达成新的六年续约协议
item.description: 沃尔特-迪斯尼（Walt Disney）周二表示，其体育网络 ESPN 已将大学橄榄球季后赛（CFP）的独家媒体版权再延长六年，直至 2031-32 赛季。【原文：Walt Disney said on Tuesday its sports network ESPN has extended its exclusive media rights for College Football Playoff (CFP) for six more years, through the 2031-32 season.】

item.title: 早间竞价：日元跃向历史低点，美联储成为焦点
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 捷蓝航空削减航线以改善财务业绩
item.description: 捷蓝航空公司（JetBlue Airways）周二表示，该公司将取消一些航线和市场，并减少在洛杉矶的服务，以改善其财务业绩。【原文：JetBlue Airways will eliminate a number of its routes and markets, and reduce service in Los Angeles to improve its financial performance, the company said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 加利福尼亚州与斯泰兰迪斯达成汽车尾气排放协议
item.description: 克莱斯勒母公司施泰兰特与加利福尼亚州周二就排放问题达成协议，此前该公司曾寻求加入其他汽车制造商与加利福尼亚州于 2019 年达成的协议，但未获成功。【原文：Chrysler parent Stellantis and the state of California reached an agreement on emissions on Tuesday after the company unsuccessfully sought to join a deal that other automakers had struck with the state in 2019.】

item.title: SAS 航空公司破产重组获美国法院批准
item.description: 北欧航空公司 SAS 周二表示，美国破产法院已批准其破产重组计划。【原文：Scandinavian airline SAS said on Tuesday a U.S. Bankruptcy Court had approved its Chapter 11 plan of reorganization.】

item.title: 日本央行下调日本国债购买额度上限，政策发生重大转变
item.description: 日本央行（BOJ）周二表示，在结束负利率和收益率曲线控制（YCC）的激进刺激政策后，将缩减购买日本国债的最大限额。【原文：The Bank of Japan (BOJ) will scale back the maximum limit of its purchases of Japanese government bonds, it said on Tuesday, after ending its radical stimulus policies of negative interest rates and yield curve control (YCC).】

item.title: Meta 预计至少要到明年才会推出新的 Nvidia 芯片
item.description: Meta 发言人告诉路透社，Facebook 的所有者 Meta Platforms 预计今年不会收到英伟达新旗舰人工智能芯片的发货。【原文：Facebook owner Meta Platforms is not expecting to receive shipments of Nvidia's new flagship artificial intelligence chip this year, a Meta spokesperson told Reuters.】

item.title: 独家报道：欧盟维斯塔格对苹果、Meta收费和贬低竞争对手产品提出警告
item.description: 欧盟反垄断局长玛格丽特-维斯塔格（Margrethe Vestager）周二就苹果公司和 Meta Platforms 的新服务收费问题发出警告，称这可能会妨碍用户享受旨在为他们提供更多选择的《数字市场法》所带来的好处。【原文：EU antitrust chief Margrethe Vestager on Tuesday warned Apple and Meta Platforms on their new fees for their services, saying that this may hinder users from enjoying the benefits of the Digital Markets Act which aims to give them more choices.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称梅西百货在公司出售谈判中公开账目
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士透露，梅西百货公司（Macy's Inc）已同意向 Arkhouse 和 Brigade Capital 公开其账目，这是这两家投资公司斥资 66 亿美元将这家美国百货公司私有化的潜在突破。【原文：Macy's Inc has agreed to open its books to Arkhouse and Brigade Capital, people familiar with the matter said, a potential breakthrough in the investment firms' $6.6 billion bid to take the U.S. department store operator private.】

item.title: 工会致会员的备忘录：空中客车公司在采取施压策略后改变了 A220 工人谈判的基调
item.description: 根据路透社周二看到的一份发给工会成员的备忘录，在开始采取减缓生产的施压策略后，空中客车公司改变了与蒙特利尔地区 A220 喷气式飞机装配工人谈判的基调。【原文：Airbus has changed its tone in bargaining with Montreal-area A220 jet assembly workers following the start of pressure tactics to slow production, according to a union memo to members on Tuesday seen by Reuters.】

item.title: Kering 警告称第一季度收入下降 10%，Gucci 领跌
item.description: 奢侈品集团开云集团（Kering）周二警告称，受明星品牌古驰（Gucci）的拖累，其第一季度销售额可能下降约 10%，使人们对该集团遏制了销售下滑的希望破灭。【原文：Luxury goods group Kering warned on Tuesday that its first-quarter sales are likely to drop by around 10%, weighed down by star label Gucci, knocking back hopes that it had stemmed sales declines.】

item.title: 得克萨斯州学校基金因贝莱德的 ESG 政策从其撤资 85 亿美元
item.description: 德克萨斯州的一家学校基金周二表示，由于全球最大资产管理公司贝莱德的能源投资政策，它将终止管理该州约 85 亿美元资金的合同。【原文：A Texas schools fund said it told BlackRock on Tuesday it would terminate a contract to manage around $8.5 billion of state money due to the energy investment policies of the world's largest asset manager.】
